interestingFact: Finland’s capital, Helsinki, is home to over 180,000 lakes in the country, and the official languages are Finnish and Swedish.
Dhaka is among the most densely populated capitals—the country itself is the eighth-most populous and one of the most densely populated in the world.
Brazil is the only country in the Americas where Portuguese is the official language.

language: Lao (plus Khmu, Hmong, Phu Thai, Tai)
interestingFact: Laos lists several spoken languages besides Lao, such as Khmu, Hmong, Phu Thai, and Tai.
Brunei had a population of around 455,858 in 2023, with about 180,000 residents in its capital.
While English isn’t official in law, it’s the de facto national language; plus, over 120 Indigenous language varieties are still in use or being revived.
Tokyo is both the world’s most populous city and among the most natural-disaster prone cities globally.
La Paz is the world’s highest capital city, sitting at about 3,869 meters above sea level.
Georgetown is the only South American capital where English is official, though most speak Guyanese Creole.
